intro: Ardisia esculenta, commonly known as the edible ardisia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, red berries that are edible when ripe. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The berries are often used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some regions.
